title: (x) Diesel Fifty Book fat egyptienne - Giza {Sebastian, Tiff}
content:
i was flicking through the Diesel Fifty Book at work and i came across this font....

anyone know what it is?

Thank you!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20110102081448im_/http:/typophile.com/files/font_3949.jpg)
author: Hibell

comments.content: There are some obvious differences, but this reminds me of [Giza](http://web.archive.org/web/20110102081448/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontbureau/giza/ninefive/) by FontBureau.

This font has the sort of exaggerated emphasis that some of Dennis Ortiz-Lopez's fonts have, but I looked through his site's collection of commercial and proprietary fonts and didn't see this. Also thought of Matthew Carter (this reminds me a slab version of his heavyweight Wrigley font for Sports Illustrated), or something Jim Parkinson might have done, but I couldn't find it in the works of either of them.

If I had to guess a foundry, I would have thought Font Bureau, but I didn't see this. Not Hoefler either.

I'm curious where this will turn out to be from.

- Mike Yanega

Oops! When Seb said there were 'obvious differences' I didn't look at the link. It seems like he got it after all. Sorry.

- Mike Yanega
